intro: Euphrasia trixago, commonly known as the trixago eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers with dark markings. The plant typically grows in meadows, woods, and along stream banks, preferring moist and well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in early spring. Euphrasia trixago is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye ailments and respiratory conditions.
